description:
I stumbled across this bar late last night after driving by, it looked empty inside minus one blond chick who ended up being the waitor.  She was from France herself and was adorable, she really made us have a great experience. As we had a glass of wine, she was so prompt to remind us of the kitchens closing soon and give us samples of the wines we were interested in.

Other people ended up coming in as well and we ended up running into some friends, had a great ambiance and was playing gun music. 

Wine was AMAZING ontop of it all! I definitely recommend this place if you are in the area and looking for some fun, chill wine in peace.
author: Ellie J.

description:
This used to be an awesome jazz club and crashed when it became a hip-hop tragedy masquerading as a crappy bar.

Now, the food is amazing. Try the cod sliders and the artichoke dip (I know, right?) They were exquisite.
.
Awesome place!
author: Carmine M.

description:
Strange, awful experience. I don't know what this place thought when they called themselves an Italian restaurant. The pizza was literally the worst I have had. Maybe the reviews are fake? 

I'd be surprised if this place exists by the time you read this. Maybe they called it Pause because they needed a moment to reflect on how terrible the experience they were creating for their patrons would be.
author: Runner F.

description:
Just Pause and don't go there!
Bad experience and a very strange vibes.
Pizza's very small, not tasty and very disappointed!
author: Aviv S.

description: This is my go to place to relax. The food is amazing, the wine is amazing and the no-screen ambiance helps me unwind after a long day.
author: Dasher K.

description: Great wine bar.... even thought I didn't order wine. I met up with some friends here right as they were finishing trivia. Service is good and drinks were good. I had a Ginga Ninja which is very similar to Crabbie's Hard Ginger Ale. The place itself is a bit tiny, but very modern looking inside. Overall, nice place. Not sure if it's my style of place, but I liked it overall.
author: Julie L.

description: Poor wine selection. Expect to pay $13 for a glass of wine that's $15 a bottle retail. The location is great but that's where the good stops and the bad starts.
author: Tiger T.

description: Can't say enough good things about Pause and Chris, the Manager on duty.  Had a special and noteworthy birthday and everything was so well done; excellent menu, a personal wine list which Chris discussed at length with me, and Chris' non stop service kept everyone content, pleased and awed.  Lovely place to celebrate a special event; mine was Saturday night and it was very quiet, which pleased me.
author: Jamie M.

description: Trivia night is a lot of fun! Drinks and food are also reasonably priced and taste good. Make sure to come early and order before 7:30 on Wednesdays, trivia night.
author: Helen P.

description:
Came on a Saturday night for a gathering. The place wasn't too busy if it weren't for the people in our party. The worker was really kind. He gave us recommendations and assisted us in choosing our glasses of wine. 

I liked their menu because they also included quick descriptions of what the wines tasted like. I appreciate that because I don't know too much about wine, thus always confused on what to order when no description is included. I tried the Pinot noir, Carmanere, and the Cabernet Sauvignon. The Pinot noir was first. Ordered it because it was light. Easy to drink but I think I prefer something more rich in flavor. My boyfriend ordered he Cabernet Sauvignon. I liked his more than my Pinot noir. Definitely had a thicker rich color and flavor. The last one the worker suggested the Carmanere to us because it's his favorite. It actually ended up being my favorite of the night as well. The carmanere was almost a hint of sweet and so easy to drink.
author: Annie H.

description: Came here for Trivia on Wed night, and had a blast. They have a few vegan options, including a flatbread pizza with cashew cheese, sweet potato, pomegranate, and arugula which was heaven.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Came in here for a semi-private event, and the bartenders were super friendly and informative.  Don't worry if you don't indulge in wine too often, because the menu has descriptions of the wines, and the workers will be more than happy to assist you.  The guy who was our bartender was very helpful and cool to chat with. 

I started off with the Cabernet Sauvignon and Pinot Noir, but the bartender highly recommended a Carmanere, which actually became my favorite.  The Pinot Noir was a little more bitter in comparison to the Cabernet, but both had good aromas.  The Carmanere became my favorite, simply because it was so easy to drink!  It was fruity, but not overwhelming, and definitely not watered down.  

Great place for anyone craving a glass of wine, and I even hear that they have trivia nights!
author: Eric L.

description:
Pretty nice wine bar hidden in sort of a dead patch of Market. Not too fancy but still nice for the area. It's pretty quiet since there isn't much foot traffic here, so it's a good spot for a more mellow happy hour.

They have a decent happy hour that goes until 7pm on weekdays: half-bottle carafe of wine for $14 and $1 off all food. I honestly don't know much about wine, but whatever red they had for the half-bottle was pretty good. 

The food isn't bad either, but nothing really appealed to me that much. Everything's also pretty pricey for the amount of food and in comparison to the price of the happy hour wine. We shared:

-COD SLIDERS ($10) - 4/5
2 sliders with avocado, cilantro and sriracha aioli. Not bad. The cod was fried nicely and not too greasy, but the sliders were a little heavy on the aioli for me.

-PESTO FLATBREAD PIZZA ($14) - 3/5
Meh. Too cheesy it overpowered everything else. Rather oily too and while some pizzas still taste okay when they're no longer warm, this one didn't cool well. I'd rather get another half-bottle than this or probably any of the other flatbread pizzas.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Now that I live a few blocks away, we had to make a stop on Wednesday for Trivia Night. Unique, corky little crowd with a very flamboyant, entertaining host. 

One thing I wish they did was offer a price break by the bottle that is standard. No real incentive to buy bottle, just grab a few glasses and your good to go. 

As far as feel, we dug this a vit more than their sister bar. Somewhat dark, edgy, clean. This is the same owner/somm as the Yield Bar in Dogpatch.
author: Roman V.

description:
I was unimpressed with Pause. I came on a Thursday night and the place was basically empty.

There were a couple wines on the menu that I wanted to taste before purchasing a glass (glasses of red wine vary from $11-$15), but was told I had to pay for each tasting. Restaurants or bars that make you pay for a splash of beer or wine before making a decision are a waste of time in my opinion. Alcohol is already sold at 2-2.5x the retail value, so ensuring you enjoy your drink should always be a top priority.
author: Emmy Q.

description:
Trivia Tuesday anyone? Yes! Everyone!

We came in a little early to take advantage of the half carafe happy hour specials that ended at 7. We've tried this twice and both times had different house reds and both were pretty fantastic. Their HH apps are pretty delish too. 

This past Tuesday was our first time doing trivia. The questions were pretty hard but made for a lot of fun. The two guys working the bar were hilarious and a lot of fun. My only complaint is that without a mic, it was hard to hear some of the questions. Especially since the interior is a little weirdly shaped so if he was facing the other way, it was easy to miss something. They were accommodating in repeating and patient with us because of that though.

All in all, I'm glad this place is in my 'hood because I'll definitely frequent it. Especially now that I have to work on getting those trivia points!
author: Carol M.

description:
Pause sponsored/donated to a neighborhood event that I attended and I got to chat with the owner for a bit - he was very nice and seemed to care about his community. I always try to go out of my way to patronize small businesses that give back to the community so I made an effort to meet a few friends here for Happy Hour. The wine bar is small but doesn't feel cramped, with a dark interior, perfect for a date. It's not loud so you can actually hold conversations without screaming at the top of your lungs. Best part, you won't find wine snobs here. Most of the other patrons were an eclectic mix of locals and tourists from the hotel next door. 

There was ample seating, and they have a private area in the back that you can reserve for private parties for no charge. Plenty of unisex bathrooms (this is my big thing - I can't do bars with only one bathroom, nope) that were clean. BTW, this is a vegan place so if you have vegan friends, this will be perfect. The food is vegetarian so if you have picky eaters, this is a good spot to find small, healthy bites. All of the wines are good and standard SF prices (ranging from $9-$14 per glass). They also have a few beers in bottle for non-wine drinkers, and fancy sodas.

They also host a weekly trivia night on Wednesdays, so I'm looking forward to kicking everyone's ass for that. 

I'm glad to find a non-pretentious, non-douche filled bar where I can find a table to sit down and talk to my friends at, so I'm looking forward to going back.
author: Logan The H.

description: Horrible, horrible, horrible customer service! I hardly ever write reviews, but this place deserves 0 stars.
author: Ali A.

description: Fun wines nice service and a nice menu. Dark oaky atmosphere makes for good wine tasting with that special person or the gang.
author: Darrin D.

description:
Good, solid wine bar. I would probably not go out of my way to come back here again but would recommend it to others who are searching for a wine bar by Civic Center. The chalk art around the bar is very entertaining to look at. The bartender was super friendly and conversational when I came here with my friend. The menu is straightforward. There is not a ton of wine that is sold by the glass, which helps with making decisions. The wine is a bit pricey but still good... not that I'm a wine connoisseur.

I have not yet tried the food, but the bites look tasty. Again options are limited but I kinda like places that specialize in a few things. They also have weekly trivia nights, which is awesome. I would come back here to check that out. Overall great experience!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
This chill wine bar was one of my best discoveries of 2015. It makes for a great date spot! 

Pause Wine Bar is the larger, sibling wine bar to Yield Wine Bar (located in the Dogpatch). Both share the same environmentally friendly ethos and offer a menu primarily composed of vegan/veggie small bites.

The staff is very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. They have made spot on wine recommendations on both of my trips here. The bar has many reasonably priced full bottle options, but don't overlook the half-bottle carafe wine options.

While the wine is clearly the main draw, the food is great as well. The grilled flatbread pizza is quite tasty, but the artichoke, kale and parmesan dip is out-of-this-world good! Be prepared to fight over that last bite of dip!

Oh, and last but not least, I'm a big fan of the regularly rotating, humorous chalk art that decorates the bar.
author: Rodney G.

description:
A secret refuge on this stretch of Market street, Pause invites you to do just that. 

Stop and sip, whether it's a Rose from Domaine Aliment-Laugner or a Cinsault from Languedoc region. Or better yet, show up for happy hour on weekdays between 4:30pm - 7pm and get selected half bottles for only $12. 

Pause and eat. Their cheese plate had fresh figs (love!) and roasted almonds. If that isn't enough to tide you over or if the conversation with your first date is so good, it extends into dinner time, you'll see cod sliders, flatbread and french fries on the menu. 

Either way, this haven near famed Zuni cafe shouldn't be missed.
author: Janice C.

description:
Wifi password: organicwine Looking for a wifi in this part of town can be more tricky than I would think.

This was really a nice unexpected stop on our stroll through the neighborhood. Being a great fan of organic wines myself, we just couldn't leave this place unnoticed. It is true, that we came a little early, but for the evening it must be a nice environment. The bar was really dark with nice decorations and couches. We were sitting on the bar, looking at bartenders work. He was really amazing, and gave us a nice overlook of his wines.

Wines were from all over the world. This must be a cultural thing, I found the wines by glass quite expensive. Me, as an European I chose a wine from California. It was delicious. I will definitely go back when Im around the corner.
author: Michaela P.

description: Cute place. Service is really good. Selection of wines are not great for a wine bar. I wanted a big, full-bodied wine. The biggest thing they had was, how do I put this nicely...not big at all. I was incredibly disappointed. We had one glass and left.
author: Jaching H.

description:
We held an event for 50 people at Pause recently and it really couldn't have gone better. Chris was so helpful and prompt during the pre-event arrangements and had everything ready for us when our group began to arrive (even 30 minutes before our reservation.) The rest of the staff were welcoming and very responsive (and even made change from their own pockets when the register ran short). We loved the food (especially the Warm Artichoke, Kale & Parmesan Dip) and the wine.

Pause is an ideal venue for small or mid-sized groups looking for a warm, attractive, and affordable place to host a party or gathering. No venue fee, no order minimum, and only a 12-minute walk or 5-minute F Line ride from Civic Center BART.

 Hope to be back soon, cheers!
author: Kate T.

description:
Add Pause to the list of amazing date night spots in San Francisco. The place is just cozy enough that you can actually have a conversation with someone and understand what they are saying. It is cheap enough that you won't throw your entire wallet on someone you may not even want to spend the night with let alone the next few weeks. Its also busy enough that you can get distracted by the people watching when you don't have anything to say to each other. 

You can also buy bottles pretty easily and cheap so that if you are in a worst case scenario you can just drink until you forget about where you are. The dark ambiance of the place is perfect and you can talk to you server about the types of wine and their best recommendations. They had a nice selection of sweet wines as well as white wines which are my favorites. 

Its not too busy on Market street on the weekdays so it is nice little place to duck into for a quick drink when you don't want to deal with a ton of people being around. There are locals and people on dates and it never feels overwhelming. There is also a back area that is dedicated to large parties and this is perfect place for those awkward tuesday night birthday parties that it is hard to get everyone out for. 

Overall Pause doesn't have many frills but it has wine and darkness. Which when you are trying to get past the second date jitters is all you really need.
author: Nick R.

description:
We stopped in here during happy hour on a Saturday. The place was empty and we happily sat at the bar and chatted with Francesca. While we imbibed on a few half carafes of Pinot Noir, we attempted to solve the weekly anagram....the solution to which I've since forgotten. We also indulged in the Francesca's Fancy Fat Fries and a bowl of marinated olives.  I think they have a really nice/varied selection of wines and there are many items on the food menu I would try next time we come back.

I could be a regular here, no doubt about it.

Oh, and I really liked the superhero chalk drawings. Two thumbs up to whoever drew those.
author: Lisa A.

description:
One of the servers with black framed glasses, was entertaining and made it a pleasant time while lounging here.  

Pause Wine Bar, like the server said, is located on the crossroad of Mission, Castro and Hayes Valley.  You take a Pause at this Wine Bar and take that in.  Nicely named.

It's a simple, cozy environment.

They offer small entrees and a good amount of wine selections.  Let me Pause here and dine over wine!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Cute place, helpful staff (made sure we knew about happy hour specials), and good food.
author: Dave L.

description: Great for Happy Hour!  We went before a show at the Nourse Theater, and it was a perfect location.  They have a wonderful selection of wines, and we enjoyed the HH red wine carafe special they had that evening plus the HH bites - filling and tasty and perfect!  Service was lovely and attentive.
author: Maile N.

description: I stopped into this cozy place before going to see a show at the Orpheum. They have some good happy hour deals- $14 for a half bottle of wine and $1 off food items. A friend and I split the carafe and ordered a cheese and fruit plate as well as an artichoke and kale dip. We were very pleased with the service and the food. It was the perfect happy hour stop before our night out. I would definitely take people back here again!
author: Charlotte A.

description: We went to Pause with a big group to do Trivia last month and this place is a hidden gem! The bartenders were extremely nice / attentive and the guy who lead the trivia, despite losing his voice, was hilarious and brought a ton of energy to the event. Highly recommend.
author: Melissa M.

description:
I would like to Pause for a second and write a review about this place. I promise, I won't "wine" too much.

Bad puns aside, I mean, yeah. This is a legit little place. If you're a wino, I think you will probably fall in love with it. I usually stick to beer or a cocktail, although a nice glass of red is a sweet treat from time to time. This would probably be an excellent spot for Date Night. 

I came here for a meetup, and I was the second one to arrive. One waitress seemed a little snippety, although the man working behind the bar was exceptional. He seemed like he might be the owner or manager, or perhaps just a stellar employee. I would definitely order your vino from him, as he smiles and gives you a fair pour. Wish I had asked for his name. 

There are a few happy hour specials on mini carafes of wine, but I just ordered two glasses: a Pinot Noir (from Momo) and a Rose (origin unknown, as I completely forgot). 

They charge tax on glasses of wine, which is strange, as I've never gone to a bar that does so. I was slightly confused when the server told me my total was $14.14  on a $13 glass of wine... yikes. So the next glass of wine (priced at $9) was actually $10.... you get the idea. It's a weird system, but I'm sure it has to be some San Francisco regulation, because I don't know why else they would do so. 

Hungry? There is a limited bar menu, but it is not a real sit-down restaurant by any means. If you want something substantial, I would suggest dining elsewhere before or after your drinks. I had some of the rosemary fries (sans cheese) and they were delicious! They were neither soggy nor twig-like, but juuust right. The vegan pizza also looked tempting, but I had just eaten a couple of hours beforehand. 

Before you even ask, yes, I did my research and made sure that the wines I was drinking were vegan approved on Barnivore. One can never be too careful. I did appreciate that the owner had called the wineries and found out which ones were vegan, and even highlighted all of them for our browsing convenience! This was a vegan and vegetarian meetup group, so of course all of us were very appreciative of that fact. He went above and beyond and made our evening a success!

I would give them a five, but I'm just not much of a wine drinker. It's nothing personal. Maybe I should go here more often and learn to appreciate the subtle art of fermenting grape juice. Until then, I will be at a dive, spending 5 bucks on a pint.
author: Brandi W.

description: Ashtonished at the rating. This place is crap on steroids - low grade wine purveyed under the guise of "wine bar". Sorry ambiance, terrible service, and customer unfriendly operation. Seriously? 4 stars?? Joke!!
author: Sanju P.

description: Cool back room for groups, nice space, great service. Fat French fry bowl. Spinach artichoke dip was just ok. The Brussel sprouts were too salty & acidic.
author: Maria T.

description:
Take a moment.

Armin Van Buuren has a few important things to say about time: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FKqkCrY0MF0

Miranda July does too: "Inelegantly, and without my consent, time passed."

In fact she has a lot of important things to say about a lot of things: http://www.goodreads.com/author/quotes/65678.Miranda_July

Found ourselves at Pause after seeing the latter in conversation about her new book. Memorable moments both elegant and not:

- Massive vegan pizza topped with an insanely good combo of cashew crème, potatoes, kale and fried leeks. Enthusiastically devoured like we were not in public.

- Dates stuffed with an unpronounceable cheese (chèvre) and profound pomegranate molasses. Best first date date ever.

- Warm artichoke, kale and Parmesan dip served with slices of bread. Almost impossible to stop at just three servings. OK maybe it was four.

- Eclectic wine list including a New Zealand blend with pomegranate notes. Works well in dates. Also works well in wine.

- While we are good at sharing food, conversation and closing down restaurants, we are not good at trivia. Keep your own talents in mind if you come on a Tuesday.

Staff couldn't have been more personable, friendly and understanding especially as our before show plans turned into an after show reality. 

Design and music (not Armin appropriate) were top notch though the fake candles seemed misplaced. Make sure you're with someone who can laugh at these things.

As Armin says, remember to live, to cry and to love. And as Miranda reminds us, time passes, especially on nights like this, far too quick.

Take a moment to pause.
author: Jason B.

description:
Fun place, like their wine selection a lot.  The HH menu is relatively sparse and while the carafe selections are a good bang for your buck, I wouldn't recommend it if you actually like good wine.  Splurge a bit more and order from their regular menu which has some incredible selections of wine.

The food is relatively uninspiring and actually something that I would personally avoid getting here in the future.

They do trivia once a week, and it's a fun environment to be in.  You don't have to participate, but it's still fun to hear some strange facts come out of the questions being asked.  The atmosphere is perfect for a date night, or just a catch up session with friends.  I would most definitely recommend it.
author: Steve A.

description:
I'm ready to be a regular at Pause. On Friday night I met six friends here and once four or five of us had arrived a member of staff took the initiative and came over and asked if we'd like to move from the bar to a table (of course we did). 

I don't know about you, but my ideal happy hour includes discounted beverages that I like enough to pay full price for (but am glad to not have to), tasty snacks and comfy seats so I can easily converse with my companions. It does not involve music so loud I cannot hear myself think nor standing the whole time near a bar where the wait for a beer is three folks deep.

Thankfully, Pause is everything I like and nothing I don't. Their snack selection includes fried brussels sprouts with lime & chili flakes, sheep cheese  
with fresh bread and grapes and fries w/ fresh herbs & Marie's spicy ketchup (there's something crazy addictive about that ketchup).

Happy hour runs weekdays 4:30-7:00 during which half bottles of wine (white, sparkling rose, red) are $12.
author: Miriam W.

description: Good vegan pizza and fries with a siracha ketchup. I love going here for wine & bar food
author: Sky B.

description: This is a cute little wine bar and an ideal place to take a date or a small group of friends. The ambiance is intimate without being loud or dark. I like that they sell their wine in carafes, and the staff were all really great and attentive. My friend and I ended up sitting there for 3 hours and we ordered a few food items to share throughout our time there. I'm taking a star off for the flatbread...sorry, it is not worth the $13 or $14 price. But the fries were good, and I had a bite of the Cod Slider that my friend ordered. It was fine but nothing to go out of your way for. If you're hungry and want a meal, I would suggest going somewhere for food first nearby and using this place for drinks and simple apps.
author: Gina G.

description: Came here two years ago and it was legendary. Literally changed my life in so many amazing ways. It was the setting of me and my life partner's very first date! But seriously, this place is cozy, cute, and the perfect spot for a few glasses of wine and delicious conversation, plus vegan bites!
author: Ashley D.

description:
Trivia night here is SO much fun. Plus, they have great happy hour specials (carafes for half price? I think?? haha). Anyway, they also have really good food - flat bread pizzas, kale artichoke dips, and cheeseeee!!!

Conveniently located between Civic Center/Hayes Valley/Castro and very close to the Muni - so you can always stumble back on to public transportation if need be :-).
author: Christina C.

description: Had no idea this place existed until friends chose it as a happy hour meeting place. And I am so glad they did. The place looks small from the outside, but there are more seats in the back. The service was excellent and everyone was very nice. They have a nice selection of wines and snacks for reasonable prices. Definitely one of the best kept secrets in town.
author: Janice O.

description:
We walked by Pause on our way back to BART from the Haight and decided to pop in for a drink.  It is really cute inside.  The walls are painted black, and some of the employees have used sidewalk chalk to draw/write on them.  There was a cute mural on one wall of a moonscape with a rocketship, etc.  

I am not much of a wine person, but my husband is a complete wine-o.  Francesca was very helpful in answering his questions about the various offerings.  She was funny and a good conversationalist.  I would recommend this place to anyone in the area who wants to just sit and relax with a good glass (or bottle!) of wine.  It also seemed like a great meetup or date spot.
author: Liz M.

description:
Alright spot. 

Nothing blew me away about this spot - the wine selection was ok, the service was fine, the atmosphere is decent (but it was a little bare for a friday night), the food was ok (flatbread and parmesan dip were both good, but not exceptional). 

Prices were a little higher than i expected - wines start at $45 a bottle.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Went for Happy Hour on a Thursday night with some coworkers. It wasn't too crowded, and the waiter was super attentive and service was seamless! We had some of the HH wine and Francesca's Fat Fries. The fries were so good! The ambiance was great, a little bright when we first got there, but the lighting was adjusted once it hit 7pm. 

Overall, great experience and will definitely go again!
author: Ayoung J.

description: I don't know if the Francesca fries are named after the bartender, Francesca, but she was pretty great. I loved her descriptions of her wine recommendations, and the wine itself was delicious. The place was also not too crowded on a Thursday night, and pretty classy. Definitely a great place to sit back and relax with a few close friends.
author: Amira A.

description:
Pause? HELL NO!

We went to a meet up there. It was crowded so we asked if we could get an extra table since there was people standing and several tables empty in the place, the answer was simply NO!, waitress is rude and apparently hates being a waitress, funny right? She actually have me and a friend to take the food, cutlery and glasses by ourselves to the table we had to go (apart from our party), because we were already there so what's the need for her to do it?. 

This table had no chairs so we had to go to the table bar and carry them by ourselves too, we didn't even asked this time to get the chairs to our table, we didn't wanted to get another no for an answer and it was obviously that the waitress would never behave like such.

The sprouts and beverages were average, so not worthy of this kind of treatment.

Pause again? HELL NO! Don't waste your time with this kind of people and place, go to any other bar in the area, trust me!
author: Paola L.

description:
My book club met at Pause wine bar last night and it was great experience all around. 

I was greeted with a friendly smile, and the guy behind the bar helped me locate my book group in the back room. Had we not been meeting, the back room would have been very quiet. Not that I don't love screaming at the top of my lungs across the table while I'm trying to catch up with friends...

They have a good selection of wines including some unusual ones and during happy hour ('til 7) they have food and drink specials! Our server was happy to answer questions and knew the list well. My Hi-Roller red blend was very good! 

I ordered the artichoke dip which was served hot with freshly sliced baguette. I was also lucky enough to try a sweet potato fry and a regular french fry. Yum! The brussells sprouts also looked amazing so I will 100% go back to try those and I was drooling over some of the flatbreads. Their entire menu is vegetarian, so that was slightly disappointing. But I guess it's finger food, it's not meant to be dinner. 

Our waiter brought our check with our items grouped together so it was easy to see how much we each owed. It's not cheap but about on par with other wine bars.

Just a note on transportation, I took muni, got off at Van Ness, and walked. Those 3 blocks in the dark, alone, can be quite intimidating. Next time I will take the streetcar which stops almost directly in front of Pause.
author: Rachel E.

description: I went here when they were having a speed dating event. That was fun to watch. It's a pretty good wine bar. But ib we going they'd offer flights.  Oh well.  Service was good.  We were told that we can order half glasses instead for half the price but it want half the price. In the end it was more like 80% of the price for a half glass. Not a big deal.  Just misinformation.
author: Pam Y.

description:
This place was great! 

Generous pours, friendly staff, and a nice setting. I took one star off because the stools were not comfy - but I did see they have couches so will give that a try next time. I am totally interested in trying out the snacks.
author: Kate M.

description: Very nice place to grab a glass of wine after a hard day out seeing the city. Friendly service with enjoyable recommendations.
author: Eddie A.

description:
I waited to write this after a return visit, to consider giving more than 1 star. Nope, I'm sticking with 1 star, and I'll gladly try to dissuade people from making plans to go to Pause. Management sets a poor example of customer service. All five of the wines I've ordered there were disappointments, the food is marginal, and the space is shoddy, with weak ambiance.

My customer service complaint: I brought my gf here before a show with an Bloomspot offer, expired by a couple weeks. It wasn't honored for the amount which I'd paid in advance - that being the money which Bloomspot had paid to Pause already! Not only is this poor operationally, it's also a violation of state law. The poor server who told me this said it wasn't her decision, but her manager's, and he wouldn't walk the 10 feet to speak with me directly, despite my explanations. 

Bloomspot didn't bother speaking with Pause about the problem, and offered my prepaid amount as a credit for a future purchase. Good riddance, Pause.
author: Mike H.

description: Enjoyable little wine bar with a very warm inviting atmosphere. decent back room for private parties although don't try to fit TOO many people back there, it can get a little claustrophobic. Parking is much easier to find here than other areas of the city, although with the rise of Twitter, this won't be the case for long.
author: Mike V.

description:
Very cute wine bar. I went here around 5pm with a friend on Thursday. 
It was happy hour ($2 off any of the food and $12 for half a wine bottle).

I went with their white wine, cod sliders and Fancy fries which were all great. A Nice cozy place, modern and chill.
author: Amy L.

description:
We found this place by chance. Our bus broke down and my friend had to use the restroom so we popped into Pause to see if we could use theirs. The bartender said no problem! and the place was cute and the menu looked good, so we decided to stay a while. We ordered a bottle of the Cabernet and a plate of the sweet potato fries. The wine was delicious, and the sweet potatoes were even better. They came with a really interesting berry barbecue sauce. SO GOOD. Between the 4 of us, they were gone in under 5 minutes. I also really loved the artwork -- take a closer look to really appreciate it. There are a few surprises in some of the paintings. 

This place was a nice surprise! Super cute, reasonable prices, good wine, good food and the bartender was really nice.
author: Alyssa B.

description:
I enjoyed a couple..ok..three, glasses of wine.  I also enjoyed the cute character drawn on the chalkboard exclaiming "Tacos!", the friendly bar staff, Chris/August/Kevin, and the fact that they are stumbling (and if needed, crawling) distance from my home.  Can't wait to try out their nibbles.

My resolution to drink less for my 29th year of life?

Promptly put ON HOLD by Pause.
author: Moo C.

description:
Pause Wine Bar is brought to you by the same folks who own and operate Yield over in the Dogpatch. 

Pause--like Yield--offers a wide variety of vegetarian wine pairings; a welcome change to the usual wine crowd fare. And now, equipped with a full-scale kitchen, Chef Kevin Schuder is whipping up more than the tapas-style entrees one finds at Yield. Delicious entrees like sweet potato gnocchi and mushroom quiche. And the wine selection is of the same standard that one has come to expect from Yield. 

The most distinguishing difference between the two places is probably the location. For those of us who are car-challenged, Pause is on Market Street right off the F-Line or within a few whistles of a taxi. Yield, not so much.
author: Jerry S.

description:
Absolutely incredible. The vegan pizzas were gourmet superb and the wine was fantastic. The atmosphere of the joint was intimate, clean and classy and the service was impeccable. 

Every time I'm in San Francisco, I will be visiting this spot. Worth every penny.
author: Jazz S.

description:
Walking into this space did give me Pause.  The smell was horrible - dirty dish water or dumpster.

Strike two:  the bartender informed us that there was a house rule that we could only taste one wine.  It felt very unwelcome.

Hotel Biron is right around the corner.  There, the servers are gracious and generous and the atmosphere is warm and cozy.  

No need for Pause.

Yield in the Dogpatch, however, is great...
author: Grasshopper R.

description:
I've come here several times now and have not had a bad experience.  I've always come here with a group of people for book clubs or just a group of us girls wanting to grab a drink and this establishment has always been so accommodating of larger groups. Though if you're by yourself or on a date or just a smaller group it's perfect as well.  There is a bar, small tables in the front, then larger tables and room in the back of the wine bar.  

They have a happy hour that we've been able to catch from time to time and would even arrive 10 minutes before it ended but was always allowed to get happy hour prices because we were so indecisive.  Half off bottles for happy hour....why not?  Always enough wine for me.....

The food selection has been great. One of my favorites is the flatbread with Granny Apples, caramelized onions, and brie.  Another common order for the table has been the grilled brussels sprouts which are dusted with chili flakes and a hint of lime.  When you're around for happy hour, I believe it's $2 off the prices of their food.  

The staff has always been great, sometimes can get busy with the amount of guests in relation to amount of workers, but will always acknowledge their customers and then help you with what you need.
author: Caroline A.

description:
Love this place! The staff are amazing, they really know their stuff and will help you pick a wine just right for you or your group! 

The food is fantastic and they have specials and seasonal items. Fran's fries are heaven for a french fry lover! You can definitely eat your meal here or have snacks pre or post opera, symphony, theater; that's the other perk. You are central to so much! 

Really good for a birthday, bachelorette event, and of course just drinks! 

Seriously, I have created a following here among friends and you will understand why after you visit. Say hi and don't take my seat ;-)
author: Tovah K.

description: Pause is fantastic place to enjoy the best wines & vegetarian appetizers! The staff are always sweet & inviting! They make wonderful suggestions & I love, love, love this place! Check it out & prepare to enjoy them too!!
author: Cori M.

description: Very cozy place to grab a glass of wine.  Extensive rotational wine list keeps things interesting.  Pours from many geographies (although mainly california).  Decent pricing on glasses and bottles, but something for everyone, even the budget conscious.  I really liked the ambiance.  Great place for conversation and catch up, as the music is not blaring.  It is more like a coffee shop that serves wine.  Definitely a great place for a late night rendezvous.
author: David C.

description:
Josh and August Rock! 
Personable, knowledgable, professional, and FUN!
Food is good, some decent wines on the list, and the place is always quiet enough that you can easily carry on a conversation. No shouting required. And if you like to bounce from place to place, Hotel Biron and Zuni are within a stone's throw...
author: beth l.

description: We went on a friday night and the place was half empty.  The appetizer selection seemed decent.  The goat cheese plate was good and just the right portion.  They offered dessert wines but oddly. Enough they didnt have desserts on the menu.  I was pretty disappointed that there were only 5 red wines offered by the glass.  The 2 that I tasted were pretty average.  Because there are so many wine bars in this city, I probably wouldn't return.
author: T D.

description:
Two friends and I came here on Trivia night.   Wow - what a fun and friendly crowd.  We found seats at the bar fairly easily.  I really appreciated the lighting in the place - light enough to keep everyone awake yet soft enough so everyone looked good.  

It was a fun atmosphere, the wine was amazing - (but to be fair, I am easy to please when it comes to winetime).

We did not try any of the food but it smelled and looked good.   

Trivia night was lively; will look forward to checking it out on a non-trivia night.
author: elena p.

description:
This is an awesome wine bar!  I came here with a girlfriend recently for happy hour, and we had a great time.  The space is warm and inviting.  The red wine on special, Carmenere, was deee-licious.  We tried their fried oyster mushrooms, which were good, but a little greasy and salty.

The real star of the show was the staff.  I wish I had caught their names.  It was a guy and a girl, and they both were so personable.  They were very attentive, kind, and even funny!  Being that I am from the South and worked as a waitress for about a decade, I really appreciate warm customer service.  

I will definitely return and highly recommend giving it a try!
author: Jade F.

description:
Fantastic flatbreads, great staff (pleasant & knowledgeable), great wine list (palatable prices, good representation of most varietals, and just enough options...not too many, or too few), nice cheese plate (though a bit small for the price). 
Definitely worth a repeat visit.
author: Vandana N.

description:
Service was incredibly rude. Came in with my husband after a long day and hearing some unfortunate family news. We were the only customers in aside from the bartenders friends who he was playing cards with and kept going outside to smoke with... When we asked if they were still serving food we were told "THE KITCHEN IS HELLA CLOSED." (Seriously) when my husband  asked again politely- so no olives or anything? "THE KITCHEN IS HELLA CLOSED." it was so unnecessarily and rude. And literally that was our only interaction with the service because he then walked over to his friends and ignored us for the rest of our time in. 

Basically spare yourself the rude and short service and check out hotel biron around the corner. Great wine friendly service- and the kitchen is HELLA open until 2
author: Marie V.

description: The happy hour rose was just not that good, the white wine was not bad. Stuffed dates were good, brussell sprouts were ok a bit too much sauce. The staff was very nice, cool chalk decor but it was just ok for me. I won't be running back.
author: Karen T.

description:
+ Perfect pre-symphony wine & cheese stop
+ Super friendly, charming & helpful staff
+ Happy hour weekdays 5-7pm
+ Amusing chalkboard wall art
+ Music - can't to wrong with Radiohead & the Pixies!

Came on a Friday afternoon around 5pm with my best friend for some pre-symphony Iibations and a small bar snack. Radiohead's "Weird Fishes/Arpeggi" was playing through the stereo and boy oh boy I was sold! Any bar that plays Radiohead has got my vote of confidence.

Chris at the bar took care of us and answered any questions we had about the menu, and chatted with us throughout our stay at the bar. Two half bottle choices were available for happy hour for $12 each (Chilean Sauvignon blanc & Carmenere). We got both, plus an order of the ARTICHOKE GRATIN ($12). The artichoke gratin took about 20 minutes to make. It had fresh fennel bulb and was sprinkled lightly with a dusting of bread crumbs on top. Quite good, but could have used perhaps a little more salt. We also had the MAC N CHEESE ($10). Melty and cheesy also with a crunchy bread crumb topping but not at all heavy or greasy. Really yummy. The HOUSE-MARINATED OLIVES were warmed and pitted and paired quite well with our wines and artichoke gratin. On top of all that, we were given a small ramekin of the HOUSE-ROASTED SPICED MIXED NUTS. A mildly spicy mix of almonds and walnuts - made for a nice crunchy snack between sips of wine. 

The HH sauv blanc was just what I like - fruity, crisp, and on the drier side - not sweet or cloying. The Carmenere had a rich, full bodied, slightly leathery taste. I highly recommend the sauv blanc if you are looking for something smooth and easily palatable. 

The decor was quite amusing - mural-size chalkboard renditions of a whale and swordfish scene graced the back wall, and smaller doodles of superhero cats and purple bunnies in hot air balloons danced across smaller chalkboard areas around the bar. We were promised that the next time we came, the chalkboard artist would have my favorite animal, the almighty blubbery manatee, chalked onto the wall. 

I loved this place and will most definitely love to make it part of my pre-show (symphony, opera, the Herbst, etc) circuit from here-on out.
author: Megan L.

description: Really good wine. Really good food. Feel free to get really dunk.
author: Shirrod R.

description:
Cute pretty much describes it. That, along with with Mr. Drunk Robot who needs his wine to function and other random chalk art really had me cozy in my bar stool before I even ordered a drink.

Great wine selection, decent happy hour pour. The nibbles were tasty too, even though we only ate the breaded oyster mushroom plate. We really devoured that one though, they were so tasty.

Friendly, knowledgeable staff, a welcome space, a variety of seating perfect for a solo sip, group nosh or date chat at the bar makes for a fun atmosphere to get rosy cheeked in.
author: Jessica P.

description: Our small nonprofit had a fundraising event in the back room on a Saturday night and had a great experience! The 2 bartenders helping us were sooo accommodating and went above and beyond with service. They frequently checked in with all the guests to make sure everyone had what they needed. My friends ordered a few glasses of wine and the bartender was very helpful with suggestions. The menu also has many vegan options! I got the kale flatbread and the fries. Both were tasty! The whole place stayed full, but never crowded the whole night, which is always nice for a low key, comfortable setting to catch up with friends.
author: Kim D.

description: Cute hidden gem! It was a great experience. Love the fat fries and mediterranean pizza. The red wine from Chile was sweet and smooth. Atmosphere was chill and cozy. Great place to catch up with a friend.
author: Kelly C.

description:
One of the best wine bars I've visited in San Francisco.  Pause is super solid and I would definitely come back again.

For a Friday night, they weren't too busy, had a great wine list, super friendly waitress, great ambience, and also had tasty food for their happy hour.  It wasn't too loud so you could have a decent conversation in this place, and they had an extra back room that could accomodate larger groups.  The waitress even went out of her way to set up a table for the 5 of us to sit down, even when we were very comfortable at the bar.

I'd recommend this place to anybody who's looking for a chill place to meet up with friends over some wine.
author: Michael C.

description: As far as wine bars go, this one seems pretty small, but the service is good, as is the wine, and the appetizers are the best of all.  It's also not that far from Civic Center BART.
author: a f.

description:
Had a great weekend happy hour with friends recently.
Service was very friendly and attentive.
We shared two lovely  bottles recommended by August. 
We started with the tasty Rosé of Pinot Noir, a great way to 
toast the warm evening.  A few of us in the group also enjoyed 
the Mencia  from Bierzo Spain. 

The $5 Happy Hour(tues-sat 5-7) offerings are amazing. 
We shared  the mussels, fries, marinated olives with walnuts 
and a great selection of cheeses. I fell in love with the helpful staff
(thanks again August), the philosophy, and the overall ambiance 
of this lovely Wine Bar as stated in the menu; "the ingredients are 
locally sourced, our recipes globally inspired". I'll be sure to return 
for a dinner date. . . .
author: Kia B.

description:
Really friendly staff. It's one of the few drinking establishments I feel totally normal coming to by myself for a drink or two and chatting with whoever's behind the bar. Limited menu but the food is very good, and they have happy hour specials on weeknights. 

As for the wine, Pause doesn't have the selection that neighbor Hotel Biron has, but their wines are an eclectic mix and they rotate often. I always feel like I can find what I'm in the mood for. They also have a back area you can reserve for private parties and flamenco night on Tuesdays.
author: Sarah L.

description: Love this place!  I reviewed Chris' other wine bar, Yield, ages ago.  I now live nearer to Pause.  Love it just as much, or more.
author: Jason C.

description: Cute wine bar, nice atmosphere.  Our group of 20 were the only ones there on a Saturday night around 9pm, but it was nice.  Four us tried a nice red, a Malbec.  Others had some champagne, though I don't what they thought of it.  Overall, enjoyable!
author: Carol L.

description:
Vino y Vino kiddos. I did an art night here and had a great time. The service is on par, the wine is delish and the food is tasty to boot. Nice nibbles to go along with the booze. 

The chevre stuffed dates were sweet and salty and the cheese with crostini's were a nice nibble for two.
author: Shira O.

description:
Came here for a firm event to learn about wine. The wine director/co-owner is also a wine director at Millenium (reputable fancy vegetarian restaurant), so a lot of his knowledge and specialty reside with vegetarian dishes. He notes that he understands the texture and flavor of meat dishes, and can recommend wine as needed.

I don't know squat about wine....

He was good at guiding the group, though I wish he can focus on the flavor of the wine more, and provide us more definitions/meanings for the different types of taste/flavor you get from tasting wine.

The appetizers are DELICIOUS! great place for a vegetarian!!

Also the other co-owner is so kind and friendly too!
author: Connie H.

description:
Cute. Cute. Cute.

Went here for happy hour with the girls and found Pause is cute from the inside out. They have super cute ambiance with neat art and chalk drawings. Happy hour is 4-7 and we were able to get $5 small plates and a few bottles of wine.

At first, I thought the service was a little slow, but once they worked out a few kinks, they couldn't have been more friendly. They're also very knowledgeable about the wine they serve - not just the flavor profile, but you really believe they've tasted it and are sharing personal opinions. We'll definitely be back for happy hour again!

Cheers!
author: Gretchen S.

description:
This place is AWESOME!!!
Great wine selections and the food are simply amazing.
They have the most friendly staff you will ever find in SF.
The ambiance is perfect for a date night or a night out with a few close friends.
A MUST-GO!!
author: Mindy H.

description: Good happy hour: $12 half bottle carafes and $6-8 appetizers. But unfriendly staff.
author: Peter C.

description: Great place to chill for a quite evening or after work drinks. It's conveniently located on Market St./ Hayes Valley area with easy access to muni or street parking. They have a wine special happy hour, delicious bites, and the staff is always extremely friendly!
author: Derwood A.

description:
This is a simply lovely place. Had dinner with a friend and she mentioned it. We walked way out of our way to go and I was not disappointed.

The location puts it out of the way but it is worth the walk, friends.

Since it is not on the beaten Polk St or wherever else hip 20-30somethings go (I am too poor to be hip) path, it is not packed and uncomfortable. The ambiance is great and the staff uses that to talk to you, be charming, and generally wonderful. Lovely decor and damn good wine.

If you want good wine and are downtown, walk, take a train or bus, and go here. It is not far, and ever so worth it.
author: Kristin T.

description:
This is one sweet spot. Super chill place with a great wine and tapas selection. Very friendly, attentive service. Lots of gluten-free options :) 

I'm definitely coming back.
author: Deirdre P.

description: Cool wine bar.  Good service and ambiance.   The bar food is classy and tasty.  I just wish they had a full bar.
author: M S.

description:
Good wine list. 
Slow, affected service. Who might just bring you the wrong wine when they finally show up. Much faster on their feet when it comes to collecting your credit card.
author: kt s.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place so when my friend suggested it I was so excited. And I'm so happy it wasn't a let down. The atmosphere was pleasant; lively but quiet enough to have a real conversation. The art was fun and unique, including a large board of corks and an enlarged copy of the permit for their sister wine bar Yield. The staff are extremely friendly and knowledgeable. The food menu was simple, consisting of tasty small plates that were also very well presented.  And the wine list was great.

Side note: I tend to chose my wines based on label (I know it's dangerous, but I hardly ever chose poorly).  I went through the wine list, and chose three I wanted to try.  Out of curiosity, I went to the counter to see the listed bottles and the three bottles I was drawn to were the three wines I had chosen. Fantastic!
author: Michelle R.

description: Cute place, but preferred if they would served wine flights then just glasses and bottles. Food was ok, a bit pricey. Overall closes early, cute little place for quick chit chat and get together but not really a place to try wines just think of the usual neighborhood bars you'll go to for a drink but for here it's a glass of wine that you know what you want already.
author: Linh D.

description:
Came here a few weeks ago with a couple friends and was delighted by the space, wine, food and service.

I had never been when it was Cava, but from what I've been told, the space looks almost identical. It's now operated by the folks over at Yield Wine Bar, another favorite wine bar of mine (where I happened to have one of the best glasses of wine in memory...check out my review) and they've done a fantastic job of offering a great selection of wine and eats in a cool setting. I was also impressed that they had a decent selection of beer available! Mind you the selection was small, but of course it's a wine bar, so you wouldn't expect it to be big. No, I was just impressed with the types of beers, specifically a few from North Coast, a favorite local-ish brewery (up in Ft. Bragg).

I'll definitely head back here to try some different wines and enjoy the awesome space.
author: Melanie N.

description:
We love Pause!

My husband and I had a joint bday party here on a Saturday night in late June, and the setup couldn't have been better. I'd looked into a dozen venues before we decided on Pause, and the reason we chose it was that the owner, Chris, was super friendly, accommodating, and flexible, and the entire staff was really nice. Also, for our particular date, there was no minimum or deposit required in advance which was great since we weren't sure how many people we'd have.

Our group ended up being about 50 people, and Chris sectioned off the back portion of the bar so that we essentially had a private space. There was a big shelf for our friends to put purses and jackets, as well as plenty of seating for those who wanted it. We had a dedicated bartender (his name was Grant, and he was awesome), and they let us bring in our own cakes without charging an outrageous cutting fee. Overall, the whole staff worked to make sure we had a great time, and we did. Many thanks to Chris and crew! We'll definitely be back.
author: Julie C.

description: This place is so fantastic! We celebrated my friend's birthday here and had made a reservation for 10-15 people, but around 30 people ended up coming. The staff was so friendly and so accommodating. I brought a cake for my friend and they took care of everything... lighting the candles, cutting individual portions for everyone, etc. They didn't even charge a cake cutting fee... that's like unheard of for nice places. The staff stayed super positive despite our large crowd. At the end, the bill didn't even include gratuity, Oh plus the food and drinks were great too :). Highly recommend this place for celebrations. Superb!
author: Vrushali P.

description:
Well this wine bar had a very limited selection, but it seems people love the happy hour prices, which i am not in SF for as i work in Pleasanton, 

I just wish they had a larger wine selection and will have to come earlier to try their food. 

As of right now it is just A-Ok a place to stop when you need a quick drink.
author: Benjamin L.

description: I went on a resent outing with some friends and shared a pizza and a couple of appetizers. The food was tasty and well priced.....also had a bottle of sparkling rose....delicious as well. Friendly and knowledgable wait staff....casual vibe.
author: Anthony F.

description:
Everything was just okay here, except the service which was super friendly.

Ordered the chardonnay which was supposed to have a "rich, creamy, lemon meringue" flavor but it was definitely less exciting than that.

The grilled asparagus with poached egg over brioche was also underwhelming. The asparagus felt more steamed/overcooked than grilled. The poached egg was a poached egg, but there wasn't really any seasoning. Brioche was decent.

I would definitely swing by again for happy hour or something -- it's a pleasant atmosphere!
author: Richa A.

description:
Great wine selection, an offering of one of my fav beers Alagash White. So refreshing plus it'll get ya drunk!!

I hit this place up during this year's pride as a good friend of mine was actually spinning there for a sort of Pride after party, drinks, dancing, some drag and a ton of great people. 

The staff is soooo friendly, there's a cosy and yet hip vibe going down. The deco is so understated but I couldn't stop looking at the art on the walls and the walls themselves. Then bar is in an odd location at the door, sometimes creating a bit of a  bottle neck, but I love how it leaves the back open for people to sit and catch up of a glass. 

I had the most fab Pinot, smooth enjoyable. 

I love the bartender and his boyfriend, who along with me danced on the sidewalk to cajole people into the bar. So much fun and good spirits all around.
author: Kelly S.

description: I usually don't write bad reviews, but this I have to write since it was so bad, it's almost funny. My roommate and I rushed to do happy hour that would have ended at 7 PM. We got there 2 minutes prior and I asked the bartender if we still qualify for happy hour wine. He said yes, but we only would have 50 seconds left and needed to hurry. I asked him if the cash register is tracking it and he replied that it was just him deciding. I looked at him and asked him if he was kidding, and his reply was 30 seconds left. At exactly 7 PM he walked away and said that HH was over. I found it extremely rude and unprofessional, so we left to the much nicer wine bar down the street called Hotel Biron. WAY cozier, better service more people. 5 stars for Hotel Biron and 0-1 for Pause! There! I said it!
author: Rita K.

description: OMG I love this bar!!! Excellent wines that change daily, super clean, super modern, super yummy dishes, its really just freaking fantastic. How can it be this fantastic? I don't know- its like the silly putty of wine bars- awesome and you have no idea how its made.
author: Emily D.

description:
was there last Friday. The small plates looked interesting. I arrived late so could not taste all of them... but they are original. 

Wine was good. 

Interesting looking place on Market. 
Overall I would try it again.
author: cyril l.

description:
I really wanted this to be my new neighborhood wine bar, Hayes Valley definitely needs one but my visit there left a bit to be desired. Namely the service...our waiter was inattentive to say the least. We would have ordered a second glass of wine but after waiting for over 20 minutes decided to go to another wine bar around the corner instead. He seemed to be chatting it up with his friends at another table rather then following up with his other tables. Eventually the bartender came around to help us, I think he noticed we'd been sitting there with empty glasses and finished plates for quite a while.

The wine selection was interesting and quite good as was the food. The small plates provided the perfect amount of food for a light meal and sharing. Had it not been for the service I would have given it 4.5 stars.
author: Kacey H.

description: I really love this place. It has nice ambiance, attentive service, and everything is delicious!
author: Nicole M.

description:
Had food and wine here last night and it was terrific! 

Great selection of (organic) wines and very underrated (vegetarian) small plates. We had a fairly large group which allowed us to taste quite a few of the plates and all were very delicious. 

The team is incredibly friendly and helpful in pairing your food and wine. 

Going to ballet, symphony, or opera? Try these instead of a big dinner at the nearby popular restos. 

Look forward to trying more wine and food here!
author: Art A.

description:
Finally got myself, my beau, and a good friend to Pause after a few weeks - which is a crime given that it is merely a hop skip from our house.

Completely impressed with the change in atmosphere initiated here from the CAV predecessor.  Chris and the team have got the vibe and ambience right - interior design strikes a great balance between hip/industrial and warm/intimate wine bar.  

We had a couple of bottles of the Argentinian Syrah, which was very good and at a great price point.  Most wines on the list are organic, and all are from eco-friendly producers.  This is normally a reason for me to be wary, but having been offered tastes of two other wines on their list and being green crusaders, they did not disappoint.

The food was stellar - we had the warm olives, burrata with strawberries, and salmon fettucine carbonara... all of which were full of flavor.  The fettucine sauce itself was a little over-salty, but the use of cured salmon instead of cured ham/pancetta was a creative twist.  We finished with the chevre-stuffed dates with chili oil and molasses, which had a good balance of sweet, savory, and a peppery kick.

There was a birthday party going on in the rear section of the bar, which undoubtedly added ambience and energy.  That said, it's a great place to host a small gathering or birthday for around 30-40 people - the space is intimate yet private at the same time, and with no bar tab minimum I'll be looking to book it in the near future.

Service was personal, warm, and friendly; yet, unintrusive - a pretty tough balance for most places in SF to strike.  We'll definitely be back.
author: Paul G.

description:
came here last night for the first time and was VERY disappointed...

disappointed because i wish they would never close!!!

this place is a great spot for all you WINE-O's out there...

great list of wines by the glass...
great sommelier with awesome wine knowledge (Francesca freakin' rocks)

will definitely be making my way back here with reinforcements soon!
author: Kyu L.

description: I met a friend here for some wine and small bites and can't wait to go back!  Everyone here is super friendly and the food is just fantastic!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Very high quality food here for a recent party. The dips were a nice combination. The flatbreads are excellent. They kept the food coming out. 

I had to wrestle between four stars and five. I ultimately settled on four because the apple-and-brie flatbread was a shade too intense; some balance would have been nice.

Still, this is a high four.
author: Charles B.

description:
CAV reincarnated. Same sort of tasty but small portioned small plates, same exact chairs and tables, same cork wall art. 

The wine list is shorter (at least for wines by the glass) but well chosen. The beer list had some nice microbrew selections. Waiters were friendly and very hipster. The kushi oysters were delicious!
author: Carolyn F.

description:
I wanted to wait until eating a meal to give a review.  As our first visit was late and we just had some lovely wine.

Our second visit we did wine and some dessert - both the chai ice cream and the selection of cookies.  Both were very good - if I had a chance to sneak more of the blue cheese and pepper cookies - I would!  They also had a great mead - that's not something I ever thought I say!

For dinner the trio of fish was great, and the nettle Bruschetta was very tasty.

So here is my dilemma - I want to tell everyone to go - so Pause will be sucessful and I can go there for a long time -but- not so popular that I can't get a table.  Oh the problems of city life!
author: Jeanie M.

description:
Definitely go to Pause because a nice new wine bar in this area is a nice change of pace.  This is a 3.5 star review that could be upped to 4 if you see below.

After reading some of the other reviews I saw they mentioned slow service.  I guess the mgmt cracked the whip and the staff was overly attentive.  I was on a date and I just don't like it when you are bombarded with "How is everything" or "Would you like another glass" and "The kitchen is closing in five minutes" as well as " How is the wine"...a few times is fine but not too many.

I do realize it was a slow night (rain) and that there was only one other table, so the staff didn't necessarily have much to do.

All in all, I like the place and will go back.  Oh and the wine list was good and the we both had two glasses of wine and the descriptions they provided were pretty accurate...which is not always the case at many wine bars.
author: J. S.

description: I've been here twice now and have been thoroughly impressed each time.  The trivia night was really fun (and we didn't even play).  I had  no idea they served food and was pleasantly surprised by the menu and the taste.  Oh and the wine recommendations were perfect.
author: L D.

description: I like this place! We wandered in for a glass of wine before meeting family for dinner and I wish we had stayed to explore the menu more. I'll have to get back here soon, especially to check out their happy hour. The wine selection was greater and the staff was super friendly and helpful. The food menu looked delicious, and I love their sister wine bar, Yield, over in the Dogpatch.
author: Anna W.

description: The wine was good and chalk board walls added great character to the place as well as the friendly staff.
author: Kristin R.

description:
Had wine and small plates here with friends last night and loved it.  The wine selection is diverse and reasonably priced, service is super friendly and the food is terrific.  This will be a great spot to grab a glass of wine and some small plates before heading to a performance at the Civic Center.

The decor is minimal but comfortable, with plenty of room for a group of friends like us (8 people).  Music was good and varied, not a constant drone of any one type.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Another wine bar? This place hides on a dreary stretch of Market Street. The staff are quite friendly, but the food and wine selection are really just in the okay range. Not bad, but not great either.

Overall, this is a nice quiet place to meet a couple of friends for a glass of wine before moving on to somewhere else, if the bloated hipster prices do not give you pause, that is.
author: J D.

description:
We had our office party this past weekend and everything was stellar!!!! Chris the owner and Francesca the events coordinator did everything to make it a special event for our company.  The appetizers and multi-course meal was fantastic.  Chris indicated that they have a new chef and he did not disappoint.   The wine selections were very nice and really complemented the courses.
This is a great place to hang with friends after work,  drink wine before going over to Zuni cafe or plan a special event.   I am a fan of their other location Yield in Dogpatch but this location is larger, has a greater food selection and is closer to my office.  Will definitely be back and also recommend to everyone I know.

Thanks Chris and Francesca for helping our event go over as smoothly as it did!!!!!
author: Jeanne F.

description: I've been here a few times for happy hour with coworkers. We love the location and the service. My best recommendation other than wine, the Brussel sprouts, they're amazing!!
author: Brenda M.

description: Nice place, good selection of wine but probably it's better to get food somewhere else
author: MyName M.

description:
They really deserved only one star. I also just noticed that the female reviews are universally positive and realized that I had experienced sex discrimination...

I waited in the dark at the far end of the bar for over 20 mins before they finally brought me water. At 30 I walked out.  They said they were training. OK, at least ask for a drink order within 30 mins. We asked if they could turn on the lights when we sat down but they never got around to it. Complete amateurs exploiting overflow of Zuni. Wine menu looked good, but I wouldn't tip on that service or those prices.
author: L I.

description:
This is definitely my new favorite restaurant! Last Saturday my friend and I were planning on eating at Zuni but decided to come next door to Pause for a glass of wine while we waited for our table. When we saw the menu we decided to eat here instead.

The cuisine is pescatarian and the menu has a ton of options. We each had a glass of wine and settled on four things to share: the Baked Artichokes, the Grilled Broccoli, the Trio of Fish and the Manchego cheese plate. Everything was absolutely delicious and was plenty for two people (although I could have eaten the fish trio all by myself).

The servers/bartenders Josh and August were adorable and so friendly: super knowledgable about the menu and helped us make our wine and food choices. They told us the restaurant had been really crowded earlier that night and the previous evenings, but we must have come in at a good time since it wasn't too crowded while we were there. Even though the restaurant had only been open for four days, they made it feel like we had been coming there forever. I can't wait to come back!
author: Cori H.

description: I was here with a date on a Saturday evening and I loved this little wine bar.  Francesca was very friendly and helpful, the Zin was delicious, the atmosphere really cute and cozy, and it was not at all busy, which allowed for a nice quiet conversation with the date.  We have not tried any food, however, I would love to do that next time I visit Pause.  Even though I planned on having only one glass of wine, I could not resist a second glass of that Zin :-)  Also, we really enjoyed the music in the background, it was some sort of soul, acid jazz, and completely added to the cozy vibe.
author: Marina S.

description: I was excited to try the new wine bar that took over the CAV space so I took a couple of my friends for happy hour to grab a drink and some light appetizers.  Mistake 1: happy hour on a Thursday.  Although the restaurant decor itself was lovely, the place was EMPTY.  Eerily.  I seriously thought a tumbleweed was going to fly by.  Once we got over that shock, we took a look at the menu and decided to have a bottle of Persecco and the Ceviche tacos.  That too was a mistake.  The Persecco was fine (although +$40) but the Ceviche tacos were OK at best.  The fish did not taste fresh but on the bright side, if you pulled the fish off, the tacos were fine.  Overall, the staff was attentive and our outing wasn't a total bust.  For my money though, I'd rather go to Hotel Byron around the corner.  Much better atmosphere, better prices, and more comfortable seating.
author: Sean H.

description: Low key, casual, modern, and yummy. A great place to meet for happy hour and a $5 bite to eat. The wines are approachable, interesting and well priced. The service is very warm, and I wish this place was in my neighborhood. This is exactly what a wine bar should be.
author: Francesca S.

description: A wonderfully grown-up place for a glass of wine and some of the friendliest, most gracious service I've experienced in San Francisco in 20 years. I showed up there an hour early to meet friends and was the first customer. Josh made me feel right at home with a crisp rosé and old soul music. Heaven!
author: Shannon C.

description:
Great wine.  Personable staff.  Low-key happy-hour setting.  Enjoyed this place.

As far as the food goes...

1.  Marinated olives and roasted nuts - a keeper.
2.  Thai Chili Patatas Bravas - where's the heat?
3.  Bay Scallop & Butterfish Ceviche tacos - fresh and delicious.  However, how 'bout a new delivery system?  That dried corn tortilla thing, though stiff enough to hold the ceviche, tasted bland and stale.  Maybe consider using a soft, fresh corn tortilla or a true corn chip?
4.  Asparagus frito misto - was hoping for something with a lighter batter.  And the asparagus suffered from being a lil' overcooked.  Good idea, though.
5.  Sweet potato gnocchi - This was a miss for me.  The gnocchi seemed too sweet to go with the accompanying sauce.

To be fair, the prices on food were decent, and nothing was terrible.  Just would like to see better execution on what are decent food ideas.
author: Marcel C.

description:
this review is long overdue... 
i am utterly impressed and to prove it, since i've been here for the first time i consider going every day which passes; less often than i want to i do.

so raw data which i am not sure anybody provided yet
5-7 happy hour (even on saturday!)
this is a wine bar with wireless

now to what's most impressive
*they are incredibly friendly - from the people in the kitchen, to chris, to the people at the bar
*every detail is thought through:
**from the wall in the restrooms, to the signs on the restrooms doors(!) to the walls behind the bar, to the handmade drawings on the bill
**from the chive flowers on the deviled eggs (although they should have called the menu item "a deviled egg") to the leaves underneath it. everything is done to perfection
**excellent wines. much better quality than what you usually see in wine bars
**fantastic music. i should remember to ask next time who is responsible for it. 

so bottom line: beautiful beautiful spot. come in gazillions and complain about the fact that they are closed TWO DAYS OUT OF EACH WEEK, maybe some protest from customers would make them reconsider.
author: tal n.

description: Sigh. I went again with a friend and was probably too effusive in raving about how fantastic it was. The second meal was so-so...some good elements, but the two menu items we were most eager to try were sold out (on a 7:30 reservation) and half of what we ordered was forgettable. Some items were great, though, and the service was still extremely friendly and well-informed. I'd give it 3.5 stars were that possible, and I still plan to return.
author: Buzz B.

description: This is a perfect place to meet friends to savor wine, conversation, and food. The decor is attractive and the staff are awesome. The food is very interesting and tasty, but portions are not large. If you're feeling like steak and potatoes, this is not the place.
author: Nicky D.

description: Came with friends for some drinks before a show - the wine was delicious, the appetizers were scrumptious, and Francesca was incredibly knowledgable and funny.
author: Heather H.

description: Pause Wine Bar provided a wonderful venue for our fundraiser! I work with Friends of ILSP, an organization that provides grants to foster youth transitioning from foster care (check us out: www.friendsofsfilsp.org), and we needed a space, and Pause helped us immensely. The layout is very nice and the wine was great. Really liked the music, and I heard the food was delicious! It's a great place to go on any evening, it seems, when you need to unwind in a laid back, yet upbeat atmosphere. We had a successful fundraiser and a great time.
author: Lem B.

description: Great place to start a nite out. My girlfriend and I found parking around the corner, had great wine and cheese. Friendly staff and great atmosphere.
author: Eric G.

description: The wine selection is excellent and thoughtfully prepared and is frequently changed.  The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable.  The atmosphere is welcoming and very cute/modern.  Love the chalk walls and art!  Only had a few of the food items but they never disappoint!  Try the blue cheese, honey and walnuts AH-MAZ-ING combination!  Wine is pricey but delicous!
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
I was excited to hear that the former Cav space was being used again, and even more thrilled to hear that it would be a wine bar.  I did not realize that it was also a restaurant of sorts; that was pleasant surprise.

The amount of wine on the by-the-glass wine list is not quite as extensive as I would prefer, but the selection is very well balanced.  It tried four of them (I was there a while / I live in the area and walk home / I'm a professional) and all were delicious.  I can't remember the exact ones (no relation to the fact that I had four glasses), but what does it matter? I'm sure the place changes the BTG selection often.

For food, I had the Dungeness crab pot pie.  Boy was it delicious and loaded with crab.  The crust was really good too.  I do wish the salad that came with it had some more heft, but I'm not a big arugula fan so more of it wouldn't have made my day.  I could have tried asking for a substitution, but I didn't want to bother and was too focused on eating the crab pot pie.  When I come back, I look forward to trying items from the antipasti menu.

I sat at the bar and the service was great.  I chatted up the other diner at the bar and the bartender.  I also enjoyed the music they were piping in that evening; the bartender said it was the chef's selection of songs.
author: Jason S.

description: I've been there three times.  Their food is always better than I would have expected, they are very creative and change the menu up frequently with what is in season.  The atmosphere is relaxing and comfortable.  It's also well priced.
author: Zach G.

description: Like its sister Yiled, this place ROCKS and so do the people who work here and so does the wine and so does the food. it is Excellent and they win for being so kind and cool!
author: Emily P.

description:
I went there for a painting and wine class and the service was AWESOME!  Everyone was very friendly and gave great wine selections.  I ended up just having their french fries and bottle of Pinot Gris but wanted to try multiple small plates!  The fries alone were delicious! They were crispy thin and well seasoned.  

If I lived in the city I would be back here more often!
author: Maggie S.

description: Wine selection is about right.   The staff is VERY friendly.   The night we were here, the two guys working were very knowledgeable, friendly, and efficient. They kept their distance but came over when needed - always with a smile.   A big plus is that the place is not pretentious.  It may appear that way when entering but the chalkboard walls with cartoons (artistically done) and the friendly staff makes for a very comfortable atmosphere.
author: Aus B.

description: Great selection of wines and great help on picking your wine - a must see.
author: Chris C.

description: Service started out great...it ended by us flagging people down. Our bottle of Rose Brut was ok, not great. I would like to come back to try the food.
author: Dee D.

description:
eh, not so good, and I'm sad because it's the perfect stop on my way home from Muni. No wine deals at happy hour and the food ranged from adequate to bad (pretty sure the mixed nuts and olives came from Costco). When I asked for a to go box for the one thing I did like, they said they'd run out. Not a big deal, but c'mon, get your shit together, little wine-bar-that-could. OH! And they really should get rid of the racist graffiti in the bathroom.
