They need to professionalize some before I go back. The lack of polish is kind of cute at Yield, but not so much here.
author: Hopey N.

description: I loved this place.  Service was superb.  Reasonable prices.  High quality.  Definitely recommend it.
author: Joel G.

description:
Had a really nice dinner. Relaxed atmosphere created by the soft lights, a food menu and wine list which are not very long but carefully assembled.

Loved the mussels with hot pepper and Thai basis, a well balanced, flavorsome disk. The Chardonnay from Hawkes (Sonoma), also defied my stereotype of northern California  Chardonnay being big, flat and excessively round

Good selection of mature cheeses to conclude.

Would definitely recommend, especially for couples or a small group of friends
author: Lorenzo C.

description: what an absolute charming wine bar! none of the pretentious vibe, just down to earth people serving great wine and great food, and if you're vegan/vegetarian this is really a fantastic spot (pizza, fries a must), most of their menu caters well! A bunch came out to before we headed out for an event nearby and the staff was super accomodating and chilled out! their happy hour deals are great with carafes and bites! go give them a shot, you will love them as much as we did, can't wait to go back :)
author: sue c.

description: My husband and I happened to come across this wine bar on my birthday because we had time before our dinner and seeing American Idiot.  This wine bar is truly a welcoming, well-designed establishment!  The people who work there are so friendly and kind.  the decor is so cool and well done!  the wine selection is amazing and perfect.  I wish you the best and so much success and we hope to visit there soon again!
author: Rona O.

description:
I went to Pause last night with a couple of friends.  The place was buzzing but we managed to find a table soon enough.  The staff are delightful--young, knowledgeable, friendly--obviously happy to be part of the business.

I usually ask for recommendations, and the petite sirah I was poured was big, bold and delicious, just what I had asked for.  We sampled several menu items--the trio of fish, the crostinis, the papas bravas, the artichokes...and the big favorite--the hiramasa crudo.  So good we ordered a second round.

I've been to Yield, and love that neighborhoody, intimate, service-focused wine bar...and I am so happy the owners were able to translate the best of Yield to the larger buzzing Pause.  Already looking forward to my next visit at both places.
author: Kathy D.

description: Lovely place.  Sandwiched between Espetus and Zuni, this wasn't our first choice for the evening and we thought we'd stay just for some small plates but when we saw the prix fixe menu, we decided to stay.  It was wonderful -- the wine pairings were perfect accents to a well paced, well presented, delicious 4 course meal.  I especially liked the mouth watering tuna with the viognier.   I'll definitely return -- wonderful service too!
author: ellen r.

description: I can't say I'm overly impressed with this place. The wine selection is pretty good, but the cheese selection is underwhelming. What I dislike about this place most is how dark and sterile the ambience is. It's also quite load, even though the tables are spread out quite well. Just a good neighborhood place to stop by after work.
author: Scott S.

description: Terrific food - everything we ordered was delicious and there are still a number of items we're planning to come back and try.  For the record, the stuffed dates are sublime.  The wine list, while not long, gave us plenty of new wines to try.  This is my new favorite spot.
author: Rhea H.

description: Great wine list!   We tried a couple of cheeses that were paired nicely with fruit/compote.  The interior of the bar is really nice and cozy and the staff is amazing.
author: Emily M.

description: Enjoyed a fun and relaxed happy hour with friends at Pause Wine Bar recently.  The staff was incredibly friendly, the wine was great, and the brussel sprouts appetizer was delicious.  I definitely recommend Pause Wine Bar!
author: Candy P.

description: i had melt in your mouth Halibut at this place, but I'm still coveting the "Eggs on eggs" that my friend ordered (deviled eggs with caviar) and my wine wine smelled as good as it tasted.  i enjoyed the pared down decor, really peaceful after a long day.  humorous chalk drawings on the walls were an added conversation piece. I'd definitely go back but would also like to try their other bar "Yield" to see the difference, if any.  it's listed on the other side of the match books.
author: Carla F.

description: Was there last night with a group of friends.  The wine was fantastic and we were well cared for by the staff.  The food was a little random but a few months ago it was amazing so perhaps they were just having an off night.
author: H N.
